page.title: 06SPINNING.
page.content: The spinning mill was opened in l787, l98 years ago. The mill was worked by water which was stored in a dam. The mill is now owned by Courtalds. l34 people are employed in the spinning mill. The fibre that starts them off is sheeps wool that gets made into lambs wool and cashmere then that fibre gets transported to Lyle & Scott's to get made into jerseys. The factory has four floors but three floors are only used. Now the building is worked by electricity. The machines used for spinning are called mules. The spinning mill has its own Union which is called the T.G.W.U. and the mill is a listed building.
